TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EventData extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The data structure encapsulating the Event being sent-to and received-from EventHubs. Each EventHubs partition can be visualized as a Stream of EventData.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.ArraySegment`1<unsigned int8> arraySegment) cil managed
Public Sub New (arraySegment As ArraySegment(Of Byte))

Docs.param: The payload bytes, offset and length to be sent to the EventHub.
Docs.summary:
Construct EventData to send to EventHub. Typical pattern to create a Sending EventData is:
i. Serialize the sending ApplicationEvent to be sent to EventHub into bytes.
ii. If complex serialization logic is involved (for example: multiple types of data) - add a Hint using the for the Consumer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] array) cil managed

Docs.param: The actual payload of data in bytes to be sent to the EventHub.
Docs.summary:
Construct EventData to send to EventHub. Typical pattern to create a Sending EventData is:
i. Serialize the sending ApplicationEvent to be sent to EventHubs into bytes.
ii. If complex serialization logic is involved (for example: multiple types of data) - add a Hint using the for the Consumer.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Body As ArraySegment(Of Byte)

Docs.summary: Get the actual Payload/Data wrapped by EventData. This is intended to be used after receiving EventData using .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Disposes resources attached to an Event Data

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Properties As IDictionary(Of String, Object)
Public ReadOnly Property SystemProperties As EventData.SystemPropertiesCollection

Docs.summary: SystemProperties that are populated by EventHubService. As these are populated by Service, they are only present on a Received EventData.
